definition: upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: The sightseer on the tower watches you.
sentences.chinese: 看风景的人在楼上看你。

sentences.english: Consecutive art space upstairs and downstairs is everyone's life stage.
sentences.chinese: 楼上楼下连贯的艺术空间，是每个人的生活舞台。

sentences.english: What place someone at the bright moon shining on the upper floors Acacia?
sentences.chinese: 什么地方有人在明月照耀的楼上相思？
楼上有人在砰砰地走动。

sentences.english: On the third flight lay a heap of dead men's heads.
sentences.chinese: 三楼上有一堆死人头呢。

sentences.english: The Suns were on the main floor, peeking up around the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 太阳在主层楼上，在楼梯附近睥睨着。

sentences.english: There's also a playroom with a cedar closet.
sentences.chinese: 楼上还有一间游戏室，里面带有一个雪松木壁橱。

sentences.english: A second, then a third brother jumped to their rescue below. Their ten-year-old brother was the last one left at that upstairs window.
sentences.chinese: 他们10岁的哥哥是最后一个留在楼上窗户旁的人。

sentences.english: You sneak a flask up there and raise a toast to the whole city of New York.
sentences.chinese: 在楼上偷偷拿走一个扁酒瓶，向整个纽约城敬上一杯。

sentences.english: If in an upper apartment, flood the bathroom to cause water to flood the apartment below.
sentences.chinese: 如在楼上就开水淹掉浴室，让水流到楼下。

sentences.english: Carry the luggage upstairs while I book the guests in.
sentences.chinese: 我为客人登记，请你把行李拿到楼上去。

sentences.english: As a sightseer watched you from a tower.
Sue was upstairs measuring for blinds when I heard a rap at the door.
sentences.chinese: 苏在楼上测量尺寸，好装窗帘，我听到叩门声。

sentences.english: She lives upstairs, over there, next door to Joe the baby-grabber.
sentences.chinese: 她住在楼上，那边，那个“捉小孩的人”乔的隔壁。

sentences.english: Can you name one upstairs cafe that you enjoy most?
sentences.chinese: 请列出一间您最喜欢的楼上咖啡室。

definition: top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
head of a flight of stairs
